sections.name: Biodiversity and Carbon Content
content: A restored marine ecosystem will sequester carbon, countering the effects of climate change. The possible amount sequesterd is not well understood [nas_ocean_geo]. The potential for seaweed growth has been estimated at 0.6 billion tons of carbon [seaweed_potential], or the equivalent of about 1.7 billion tons of CO<sub>2</sub>, about 4% of annual world emissions today.
Ecosystem restoration could be done by removing the negative pressures on marine ecosystems, including plastic pollution and bottom trawling [nas_ocean_geo].
